location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Nicholas Hankey Smith, Resident at Bushire to Jonathan Duncan, President and Governor in Council, Bombay

physicalDescription.extent: Condition: The item has suffered from pest damage, which has left a number of large holes in the body of the letter and some of the text is difficult to read.

mods.abstract: The letter is conveying proposals from Aga Mahomed Beybauny and Syeed Tuckee concerning the sale of wool stored at the company's warehouse. The Resident also notes his own opinion on the proposals and makes recommendations to the Government of Bombay.
